intro: Andryala pinnatifida var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved andryala, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are broad and pinnately divided, while its small white flowers bloom in clusters. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
